decks.notes: The core strategy of this deck revolves around quickly developing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Noble Hierarch and Ice-Fang Coatl, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures with enter-the-battlefield abilities like Soulherder and Reflector Mage to control the battlefield. The inclusion of powerful options like Collected Company and Sword of Fire and Ice provide additional flexibility and reach, allowing the deck to win games quickly while maintaining a strong tempo advantage.

The key concept of this Amulet Titan deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, in order to quickly assemble a powerful combo. This combo revolves around utilizing cards like Tolaria West and Gemstone Mine to generate extra mana and play additional lands, ultimately leading to a game-winning sequence involving multiple lands entering the battlefield at once and triggering powerful abilities to overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently setting up this combo, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the mechanic of Dredge to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, enabling powerful synergies and combos. By using cards like Shriekhorn and Life from the Loam, the player can continually dredge and bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards such as Creeping Chill and Conflagrate provide extra reach and potential for quick finishes. The main goal of the deck is to establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with relentless graveyard recursion and powerful combos.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with cards like Grisly Salvage, Once Upon a Time, and Stitcher's Supplier. By using cards like Vengevine, Prized Amalgam, and Gravecrawler, this deck can bring back threats from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Creeping Chill provides additional reach and life gain, while cards like Merfolk Secretkeeper and Hedron Crab help mill the opponent and fuel the graveyard interactions. Overall, this deck aims to quickly assemble a board presence and win the game through repeated recursion and aggressive attacks.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. It also utilizes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain control of the battlefield. The deck's mana base is optimized to support the high-cost Eldrazi creatures, ensuring that they can be cast consistently and quickly. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, this deck aims to put pressure on opponents and secure victories through fast, efficient plays.

The focus of this deck is to deal a consistent stream of direct damage to the opponent's life total as quickly as possible, using efficient and low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck aims to maintain pressure and control the pace of the game by forcing the opponent to react to its threats, while also utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for playing spells. With a strong mana base and a focus on consistency, this deck aims to close out games swiftly and decisively.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various artifacts and powerful spells to disrupt your opponent's game plan while generating value from cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza, Lord High Artificer. Leveraging cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Cryptic Command to control the board and protect your key pieces like Sword of the Meek and Thopter Foundry. The deck aims to outvalue opponents through card advantage and powerful synergies between artifacts, creatures, and control spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting your opponent's game plan by utilizing Elemental creatures with powerful abilities. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Smokebraider and Aether Vial, while generating card advantage with Risen Reef and Vesperlark. The deck also includes powerful interaction spells like Dismember and Fulminator Mage to deal with threats. By combining tribal synergy with control elements, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in the long game.

This deck revolves around controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes a variety of graveyard recursion effects, such as Mystic Sanctuary and Life from the Loam, to maintain card advantage and outvalue opponents. The deck also has access to powerful board wipes like Dead of Winter and versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually pulling ahead in card advantage and ultimately closing out the game with powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk and Field of the Dead.

The deck revolves around cycling creatures with cards like Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid to fill up the graveyard, and then casting Living End to return all the creatures to play from the graveyard. The deck also uses cascade spells like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread to find Living End and trigger its effect. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while also disrupting their mana base with cards like Fulminator Mage. It's a high-risk, high-reward strategy that can lead to explosive wins.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that work together to create powerful combo interactions. Using cards like Finale of Devastation and Eladamri's Call, the player can search for specific creatures to combo with Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies, generating infinite mana to win the game. Stoneforge Mystic and Sowrd of Light and Shadow provide additional value and protection, while Oko, Thief of Crowns offers disruption and additional utility. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents with its versatile toolkit of creatures and combos.

This deck utilizes the "Dredge" mechanic to rapidly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing for quick and powerful combos. By milling cards with cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier, the deck can trigger graveyard abilities of cards like Vengevine, Prized Amalgam, and Creeping Chill. By filling the graveyard with creatures and utilizing cards like Gravecrawler and Carrion Feeder, the deck can quickly amass a powerful board state and overwhelm opponents. The synergy between graveyard recursion and powerful creatures is the key to the deck's success.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent by taxing their resources with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also utilizing Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Displacer to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the game by manipulating the opponent's hand with cards like Tidehollow Sculler and disrupting their mana base with Ghost Quarter. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while Path to Exile provides removal. This aggressive Death and Taxes strategy aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

This deck focuses on aggressively reducing your own life total to take advantage of the powerful Death's Shadow creature. It includes a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control your opponent's hand, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Path to Exile to clear the way for your threats. The deck also includes ways to protect your creatures such as Giver of Runes and Faith's Shield, as well as ways to bring back key creatures with Unearth. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a large, threatening Death's Shadow.

The deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy in combination with other artifacts and creatures to generate a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By assembling the necessary pieces and taking advantage of cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza, Lord High Artificer, the deck can generate tons of mana and/or creatures while drawing cards and controlling the board. The key strategy is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently to outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana and card draw to combo off with the cards Gifts Ungiven, Desperate Ritual, and Pyretic Ritual to find and cast massive spells like Past in Flames and Grapeshot. Key cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer help reduce the cost of spells to facilitate the combo. The goal is to cast a high number of spells in one turn to deal a lethal amount of damage to the opponent in a single turn.
